Guide_worldbox.name: Supply pod
Guide_worldbox.description: <jinse>Supply pods</> sent by Hykros to every shelter that are often robbed by Ravagers. Unlocking supply pods can obtain abundant resources as well as increase <jinse>exploration progress</> for the area.

Guide_worldgem.name: Black nucleus
Guide_worldgem.description: <jinse>Black nucleus</> is a rare material that can be traded to <jinse>Agnes</> in the shelter for items.

Guide_worldtoy.name: Exploration
Guide_worldtoy.description: Aida is a planet full of unsolved mysteriesâ€”some are artificial, and some are naturally formed. Solve them to obtain <jinse>black nucleus</>.

Guide_worldminigamenpc.name: Training Facilities
Guide_worldminigamenpc.description: Mysterious installations scattered throughout the world. Supposedly, they are <jinse>training</> devices from before the Cataclysm. Must be activated at a <jinse>specific time</>.

Guide_worldflyflower.name: Dandelion
Guide_worldflyflower.description: Dandelion with black nucleus inside. <jinse>Strike</> the seed to get the black nucleus.

Guide_worldfireflower.name: Kerosenia
Guide_worldfireflower.description: A common herb rooted in underground petroleum veins. It is said that good stuff hides beneath the oil stored in the plant.

Guide_worldeatflower.name: Chowchow
Guide_worldeatflower.description: Strange plants that love to consume <jinse>water cores</> and supposedly regurgitate something in return.

Guide_worldbrambles.name: Thornvine
Guide_worldbrambles.description: Thornvines that wrap around treasure. Can be set on <jinse>fire</>.

Guide_worldnanometal.name: Omnium pillar induction plate
Guide_worldnanometal.description: Stone <jinse>Omnium pillar</> induction plate. Activate it and see what happens.

Guide_worldfloatbarrier.name: Singularity Rock
Guide_worldfloatbarrier.description: Odd rocks that can be unearthed and levitated by <jinse>certain Relics</>. Often buried with other mysteries.

Guide_worldairattack.name: Force Induction Plate
Guide_worldairattack.description: Stone force induction plate activated by intense <jinse>downward impact</>. Activate it and see what happens.

Guide_worldcoredrone.name: Black Nucleus Drone
Guide_worldcoredrone.description: A drone carrying black nucleus. <jinse>Knock it down</> and get the black nucleus it's hauling.

Guide_worldjigsawbox.name: Spliced metal box
Guide_worldjigsawbox.description: Metal box with special surface pattern. <jinse>Splice</> with a corresponding box to get hidden treasure.

Guide_worldlitmushroom.name: Glowshroom
Guide_worldlitmushroom.description: Resilient mushroom cluster that <jinse>lights up</> when stomped. Rumor has it that good things happen when you light them up in <jinse>certain order</>.

Guide_worldthrowfit.name: Earthphyte
Guide_worldthrowfit.description: Plant in a variety of colors. Find buds with <jinse>matching colors</> and put them in the <jinse>center</> to get black nucleus.

Guide_worldburrow.name: Tar Pit
Guide_worldburrow.description: Cave full of solid <jinse>flammable</> petroleum blocks. Who knows what else is inside.

Guide_worldvolcano.name: Lava Pit
Guide_worldvolcano.description: A common natural phenomenon. Most of the self-replenished lava comes from deep underground and originated from decaying molten magma and radioactive substances.

Guide_worldLaser.name: Concentration Ray
Guide_worldLaser.description: The concentration ray can gather and convert nearby <jinse>fissure</> energy into nucleus. Find this device and deliver the energy to activate the shattered rift.

Guide_worldPassDoor.name: Abandoned Truck
Guide_worldPassDoor.description: A freight truck for Banges abandoned after a Ravager assault, but the sturdy gate protected the cargo. Decode the password using the <jinse>encryptodroid</> next to the vehicle.

Guide_worldBarrier.name: Energy Screen
Guide_worldBarrier.description: A special defensive measure, requiring the right password to open. The surrounding <jinse>encryptodroids</> seem to have the information on how to open it.

Guide_worldFB.name: Ruins
Guide_worldFB.description: <jinse>Ruins</> left over from the Cataclysm, containing abundant <jinse>Relic materials</> as well as unknown danger.

Guide_VeraFeedAnimal.name: The Hungry Little Critter
Guide_VeraFeedAnimal.description: The small animal seems to want some food... Perhaps feeding it with the corresponding food can obtain something decent in return?

Guide_VeraInteractAnimal.name: The Friendly Little Critter
Guide_VeraInteractAnimal.description: The very friendly small animal looks like it is not afraid of strangers at all... Perhaps interacting with it can obtain something decent in return?

Guide_VeraEleSceneBox.name: Elemental Supply Pod
Guide_VeraEleSceneBox.description: Supply pods wrapped in elemental membranes require specific elemental attacks to unlock.

Guide_VeraPerspectivePuzzle.name: Ruin Stones
Guide_VeraPerspectivePuzzle.description: The ruin stones in Vera have marks remaining on them, and they appear to fit together when viewed at a certain angle.

Guide_VeraMatrixSceneBox.name: Energy Repeater
Guide_VeraMatrixSceneBox.description: Activate the Energy Repeater to remove the energy barrier around the matrix chest and obtain the rewards within.

Guide_VeraVisionCapture.name: Sequence Watcher
Guide_VeraVisionCapture.description: Activate the viewpoint camera to obtain control over the floating Sequence Watcher. Use the Sequence Watcher to locate the hidden rewards.

Guide_VeraChaosCube.name: Chaos Cube
Guide_VeraChaosCube.description: Strike the Chaos Cube to activate it. Strike a fully activated Cube Core to obtain rewards.

Guide_mon_hum_002_stic.description: The lowest level of enforcers for the Hyenas. Weak yet brutal.

Guide_mon_hum_002_bow.description: Archer watchmen for the Hyenas, shooting arrows they either scavenged or robbed.

Guide_mon_hum_002_torch.description: Perpetually drunk arsonists. Even fellow Hyenas keep them at arm's length.

Guide_mon_hum_002_bomb.description: Mad bombers of the Hyenas gang. Love to blow up enemies, sometimes themselves too, with homemade explosives.

Guide_mon_ele_001.description: Low-level aberrant who implode after losing control of their emotions. No resistance whatsoever against cold.

Guide_mon_ele_004.description: Humongous aberrant sandworms that wandered the dunes for food. Very apprehensive of flame attacks.

Guide_mon_ele_005.description: Mechanical lifeform born of Omnium. Comprised mainly of water, thus easily destroyed by high voltage.

Guide_mon_ele_008.description: Mechanical lifeform born of Omnium. Practically a ball of fire and conspicuously susceptible in low-temperature environments.

Guide_mon_ele_012.description: Mechanical lifeform born of Omnium. Practically a sphere of electricity and becomes unstable when exposed to fire.

Guide_mon_ele_015.description: Mechanical lifeform born of Omnium. Practically a ball of ice that does not stand up to high temperature at all.

Guide_Mon_Hum_001_BP_Base.description: Iconic giant scissors, big enough to intimidate newcomers to the wasteland.

Guide_mon_hum_001_warglaive.description: Enthusiastic thugs for the Hyenas, famous for their bouncing style of fighting.

Guide_mon_hum_003_claymore.description: When mad dwarves meet fiery armors... Only low temperature can cool off their desire to destroy.

Guide_mon_hum_003_saw.description: Calm its roaring blistering sparks with low temperature.

Guide_hum_004_bow.description: Able to hit enemies with precision using aim-assistance eyepatch, but still miss sometimes.

Guide_hum_004_spear.description: Spearmen with aerial combat ability. They should improve your luck significantly.

Guide_mon_hum_005_hummer.description: Tremendous raw power keeps him as the top enforcer. Watch out for his maul.

Guide_mon_hum_005_thrower.description: Rock, baseball, bomb, even crumpled paper... You never know what's in his garbage bin until it hits you on the head.

Guide_mon_hum_006_katana.description: Originally security droids made by Banges, now modified to project frost attack.

Guide_mon_hum_007.description: The heavy hitter for the Heirs of Aida. He can obliterate enemies easily with tremendous firepower. Try to freeze him if you must fight him.

Guide_mon_hum_007_saw.description: Compared to the roar of the saw, the vapid smile is even more intimidating.

Guide_mon_hum_009.description: A fungus-based lifeform that evolved due to Omnium. Peaceful by day, violent by night. It's afraid of fire just like ordinary flora.

Guide_mon_hum_010.description: Battle droids manufactured by Banges. A leakage design flaw actually gave them electrical attacks.

Guide_mon_hum_012.description: The Ravagers' newest mech. Slower, bigger, and very high-maintenance, though lasting twice as long as Hyena mechs.

Guide_mon_hum_014.description: Ravager aerial troop. Adequately equipped, a shame they're just mediocre fighter.

Guide_mon_hum_015.description: Ravager ground troop, a legion of brutes with remarkable hand-to-hand fighting abilities.

Guide_mon_hum_016.description: Weaponized mechs powered by Omnium. Plain but known for performance and high cost.

Guide_mon_hum_017.description: Warriors secretly cloned and trained by the Heirs of Aida. Combat is their sole purpose.

Guide_mon_hum_018.description: Gunners secretly cloned and trained by the Heirs of Aida. Bullseye sharpshooters.

Guide_mon_hum_019.description: Experimental subject that escaped from a destroyed lab. Its DNA sequence has been modified, no one knows what this creature was originally. Very little is known about it, except it's savage and highly aggressive.

Guide_mon_hum_022.description: Originally a wild beast aberrated by Omnium, only to become more ferocious after cyber modification. The metal shell made it invulnerable.

Guide_mon_hum_026.description: Guardbot from the Old Federation era that malfunctioned and lost all recognition capabilities after the Omnium Shock. The backside antenna can stun targets with intense flashes, so dodge if you can.

Guide_mon_hum_027.description: Giant killer bees aberrated by Omnium. Not resistant against cold.

Guide_mon_hum_028.description: The red glows in their eyes indicate their thirst for blood. Incinerate them with fire.

Guide_mon_hum_029.description: Nothing is screaming in its head except: Fight! Rip them apart!

Guide_mon_hum_031.description: Hard scale coupled with a pair of sharp claws give it the courage to fight humans, yet still can't overcome its fear of fire.

Guide_mon_hum_032.description: Hyenas dressed up in sorcerer costumes. Fearful of lightning, the staves in their hands are merely metal sticks.

Guide_mon_hum_033.description: Nimble assassins for the Hyenas, carrying a dagger that discharges high voltage, but may malfunction in low-temperature environments.

Guide_mon_hum_034.description: Wander the world with nothing but the blade.

Guide_mon_hum_035.description: A fashionable thug gang within the Hyenas, carrying a heat-charged baseball bat that easily explodes when hit by cold air.

Guide_mon_hum_036.description: Every bit as powerful and terrifying as looked, befitting the "Sweeper" moniker. Cold is its only weakness.

Guide_mon_hum_037.description: Bioengineered by the Hyenas for mining and transportation purposes. Excellent stamina, but the cyberware limited its offensive maneuverability.

Guide_mon_hum_038.description: Watch out for the venomous sting!

Guide_mon_hum_039.description: Cunning and agile rodents. Shotgun is probably the best way to deal with these critters.

Guide_mon_hum_042.description: Speckled lizard easily frightened by electricity.

Guide_mon_hum_044.description: A bizarre creature covered in head-like appendages all over the body. Shies away from fire to preserve its lovely hair.

Guide_mon_hum_045a.description: The Ravager faction that no one should ever underestimate. They fight just as well as men, and their unpredictability secured their spot as one of the most powerful groups in the Ravagers.

Guide_mon_hum_045b.description: The Ravager faction that no one should ever underestimate. They fight just as well as men, and their unpredictability secured their spot as one of the most powerful groups in the Ravagers.

Guide_mon_hum_046.description: Experimental subject that escaped an unknown lab many years ago and miraculously survived the Cataclysm. It still couldn't avoid the effects of Omnium, which caused crystallizations to form on its body.

Guide_mon_hum_047.description: Commonly sighted wolves like to move in packs. Just like most beasts, they don't like fire.

Guide_mon_hum_048.description: The Ravager dog trainer proved that, with proper techniques, even aberrant canines could be domesticated.

Guide_mon_hum_049.description: Self-exploding spiders developed by the Ravagers. Tiny and hardly noticeable, thus always a big problem.

Guide_mon_hum_050.description: Elite fighter of the Heirs of Aida, nicknamed Windblade. Master of the electrified double blade.

Guide_mon_hum_052.description: Hyena members who voluntarily replaced their left arm with an EM blaster.

Guide_mon_hum_053.description: Volunteered for Heirs of Aida modification, highly aggressive with formidable combat skills. A top fighter in the organization.

Guide_mon_hum_054.description: Vicious boar, highly aggressive, but nevertheless still hunted down for food.

Guide_mon_hum_055.description: The ferocious beast Wanderers would least want to meet. Powerful paws can shatter bones easily.

Guide_mon_hum_056.description: Beings affected by Omnium radiation. Resistant to extreme temperatures, though tissues showed no obvious enhancement.

Guide_mon_hum_057.description: Beings with abnormally large physique. Resistant to conventional attacks, but fire is a known way to deal with them effectively.

Guide_mon_hum_060.description: Gorgers that arrived on Aida through the dimensional passage opened accidentally by a probe. Nimble, highly aggressive, release spikes that drain the target's lifeforce. Very resilient, seemingly killable only through special, drastic means.

Guide_mon_hum_061.description: Gorgers that arrived on Aida through the dimensional passage opened accidentally by a probe. Emit energy pluses from their vocal sacs as their primary attack. Very resilient, seemingly killable only through special, drastic means.

Guide_Boss_hum_001.description: Big aberrant that underwent forced modifications. Very dangerous when rampaged. The metal parts on its body made it susceptible to electricity.

Guide_Boss_hum_002.description: Aberrant warrior with some intelligence. Proficient with shields. Hesitant when faced with frost attacks.

Guide_Boss_hum_005.description: Steel dragon lurking in a certain ruin. Its awesome destructive power is a testament to Old Federation technology.

Guide_Boss_hum_006.description: Plantlike humanoid lifeform created through unknown means. Inherited the tenacity of plants, but also the innate fear of fire.

Guide_Boss_hum_007.description: A notorious killing machine for the Hyenas. Frost weapons are the choice when confronting this embodiment of fiery aggression.

Guide_Boss_hum_008.description: Mad man who forsakes hair in favor of arson. Perfectly comfortable in high heat but susceptible to cold.

Guide_Boss_hum_009.description: A combat machine cloaked in green lightning. High temperature can do bad things to the high-energy battery inside it.

Guide_Boss_hum_010.description: Rumors indicate it's one of the mechs from an unknown ruin. Not even pre-Cataclysm technology fits its profile. The only known fact is it's not as resistant to water.

Guide_Boss_hum_012.description: The Puppet Singer is a creature taken over by the Abyssant. It has a strong urge to mimic human behavior. It is very agile.

Guide_Boss_hum_014.description: Allegedly a cyber creature that escaped from a lab. Huge and completely irrational. The fear of cold is programmed into it, perhaps done as a measure to control the behemoth.

Guide_Boss_hum_015.description: Ferocious beast lurking in the Crown swamp with an unknown past. It can breathe frost but does not stand up to electricity well.

Guide_Boss_hum_015_sand.description: The Magma is the original form of the Sobek found in Aesperia. It exhibits a bigger size and resides on top of the food chain in the Vera Desert.

Guide_Boss_hum_016.description: The researcher referenced her pet when designing the shape, possibly in memory of something. It must be noted that Greenbird is a dead ringer for her pet, especially in aggressiveness and temperament.

Guide_Boss_hum_017.description: As if referencing some kind of cooking method, this armor was unexpectedly given a freezing ability. Its frame is vulnerable to fire.

Guide_Boss_hum_018.description: Powerful aberrant created through bioaberration drugs. Lost all semblance of humanity and reason. Extreme cold should put it down quickly.

Guide_Boss_hum_019.description: One of the Angels of Clemency created by Heirs of Aida, designated as Number 2. A towering, efficient walking humanoid weapon.

Guide_Boss_hum_020.description: Veritable queen of the Hyenas in the Crown region. The stiletto heels and the chainsaw in her hands are equally devastating.

Guide_Boss_mech_002.description: The unrecognizable appearance, the psychotic mind... Can all this really make Shirli happy? Electrical interference can perhaps short out some of the circuits and ease her pain.

Guide_Boss_hum_021.description: His father made him into a cyborg, but did he ever have a say in that? Now, the electrical buzzing when he goes berserk is the only reply.

Guide_Boss_hum_022.description: One of the Angels of Clemency created by Heirs of Aida, designated as Number 3. Able to control multiple nimble cybernetic arms. Very few can withstand her multi-angle attacks.

Guide_Boss_hum_025.description: Originally a beast raised by someone, it escaped by accident and aberrated through Omnium exposure. Shreds all prey before it mercilessly. Its roar is a nightmare to many.

Guide_Boss_hum_026.description: One of the Angels of Clemency created by Heirs of Aida, designated as Number 4. Petite but incredibly explosive, riding in a large machine equipped with cyberweapons, whose control is linked to Seele's consciousness.

Guide_Boss_hum_027.description: One of the Ravager bosses and in pursuit of Lady Sweetie's affections. He will do anything for his "sweetie" in return, even getting a tattoo to show his love. Obviously, messing with someone in infatuation isn't a wise thing to do... but Pallas's feelings seem to be one-sided?

Guide_Boss_hum_029.description: Her system was hacked and subsequently controlled by Sage. The person who fought alongside me is now a ruthless, cold war machine. It's hard to fight her, but I have no choice...

Guide_Boss_hum_032.description: Valkyrie, the Number 1 that other Angels of Clemency spoke of, has a mysterious past just like them. But more conspicuously, she always acts alone, and seems more interested in toying with opponents than straight up fighting them. She's rather flippant with words, which drew criticisms from Frigg.

Guide_boss_hum_044.description:
A humanoid Abyssant that is unique even among the Abyssants. It has a frightening appearance. Weak human life signs can be detected coming from within.
"Whisperer of the gray curtain, the dark tide is rising, and I am here as promised..."

Guide_ShowMouse.name: Show Mouse
Guide_ShowMouse.description: Hold left Alt key to show and move the mouse

Guide_Element.name: Elemental Suppression
Guide_Element.description: All enemies have a weakness. Attacking each with the right element will deal more damage (For example: Volt attacks on enemies weak to the volt element will incur greater damage).

Guide_WeaponElement.name: Weapon Element
Guide_WeaponElement.description: Weapons have different elemental leanings, able to cause freeze, burn, electrify, and grievous effects.

Guide_Boss_hum_023.description: Originally a mild giant frog living in the bog, until Heirs of Aida modified it into a rampaging aberrant behemoth that's forever hunting food to satiate its bottomless belly.

Guide_weaponSlot.name: Weapon Resonance
Guide_weaponSlot.description: Equipping weapons to different slots causes resonance and grants different bonus effects.

Guide_Shield_Normal.name: Elementless Shield
Guide_Shield_Normal.description: This shield has no elemental resistance to reduce elemental damage. Use weapons that target the enemy's weak point.

Guide_Shield_PHY.name: Physical Shield
Guide_Shield_PHY.description: Green physical shields are much harder for physical attacks to shatter. Elemental weapons are recommended.

Guide_Shield_FIRE.name: Pyroshield
Guide_Shield_FIRE.description: Red Flame Shields are much harder for flame attacks to shatter. Non-flame weapons are recommended.

Guide_Shield_Thunder.name: Electroshield
Guide_Shield_Thunder.description: Purple Volt Shields are much harder for volt attacks to shatter. Non-electricity weapons are recommended.

Guide_Shield_Ice.name: Frostshield
Guide_Shield_Ice.description: Blue Frost Shields are much harder for frost attacks to shatter. Non-frost weapons are recommended.

Guide_Shield_Blend.name: Multishield
Guide_Shield_Blend.description: Gold multishields are resistant to many elements. Use weapons matching target's weak point recommended.

Nitai_mlr_SSR.name: Meryl
Nitai_mlr_SSR.description: Unlock Rosy Edge to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Meryl, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_smr_SSR.name: Samir
Nitai_smr_SSR.description: Unlock Dual EM Stars to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Samir, the weapon's Simulacrum.

nitai_xiuma_SSR.name: Huma
nitai_xiuma_SSR.description: Unlock Molten Shield V2 to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Huma, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_xiluo_SSR.name: Shiro
Nitai_xiluo_SSR.description: Unlock Chakram of the Seas to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Shiro, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_kelaodiya_SSR.name: Claudia
Nitai_kelaodiya_SSR.description: Unlock Guren Blade to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Claudia, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_Gulan_SSR.name: Cobalt-B
Nitai_Gulan_SSR.description: Unlock Flaming Revolver to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Cobalt-B, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_kekelite_SSR.name: Cocoritter
Nitai_kekelite_SSR.description: Unlock Absolute Zero to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Cocoritter, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_Ling_SSR.name: Zero
Nitai_Ling_SSR.description: Unlock Negating Cube to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Zero, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_sifengyuanyu_SSR.name: Tsubasa
Nitai_sifengyuanyu_SSR.description: Unlock Icewind Arrow to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Tsubasa, the weapon's Simulacrum.

NItai_King_SSR.name: KING
NItai_King_SSR.description: Unlock Scythe of the Crow to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as KING, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_wuwan_SSR.name: Crow
Nitai_wuwan_SSR.description: Unlock Thunderblades to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Crow, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_aige_SR.name: Echo
Nitai_aige_SR.description: Unlock Thunderous Halberd to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Echo, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_xi_SR.name: Ene
Nitai_xi_SR.description: Unlock Pummeler to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Ene, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_xierda_SR.name: Hilda
Nitai_xierda_SR.description: Unlock the Terminator to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Hilda, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitrai_bailin_SR.name: Bai Ling
Nitrai_bailin_SR.description: Unlock Nightingale's Feather to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Bai Ling, the weapon's Simulacrum.

NItai_peipei__SR.name: Pepper
NItai_peipei__SR.description: Unlock Staff of Scars to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Pepper, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_naimeixisi_SSR.name: Nemesis
Nitai_naimeixisi_SSR.description: Unlock Venus to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Nemesis, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_fulijia_SSR.name: Frigg
Nitai_fulijia_SSR.description: Unlock Balmung to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Frigg, the weapon's Simulacrum.

Nitai_leibei_SSR.name: Ruby
Nitai_leibei_SSR.description: Unlock Spark to venture in the Tower of Fantasy world as Ruby, the weapon's Simulacrum.

operate_Dj.name: Greatsword
operate_Dj.description: Instructions for greatswords. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Df.name: Shield Axe
operate_Df.description: Instructions for shield axe. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Cq.name: Long Spear
operate_Cq.description: Instructions for long spears. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Sd.name: Dual Blades
operate_Sd.description: Instructions for dual blades. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Gj.name: Bow
operate_Gj.description: Instructions for bows. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Dd.name: Daggers
operate_Dd.description: Instructions for daggers. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Fz.name: Staves
operate_Fz.description: Instructions for staves. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Dcp.name: EM Blaster
operate_Dcp.description: Instructions for EM blasters. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Dc.name: Hammer
operate_Dc.description: Instructions for the Maul. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Hq.name: Guns
operate_Hq.description: Instructions for guns. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Sq.name: Dual Pistols
operate_Sq.description: Instructions for dual pistols. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Ld.name: Scythe
operate_Ld.description: Instructions for scythes. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Hr.name: Chakram
operate_Hr.description: Instructions for chakrams. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Yn.name: Omnium
operate_Yn.description: Instructions for Omnium weapons. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Qmx.name: Venus
operate_Qmx.description: Instructions for the Hovering Cannon. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Bemk.name: Balmung
operate_Bemk.description: Instructions for the Balmung. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

operate_Spk.name: Spark
operate_Spk.description: Instructions for the Spark. Learn how to use the skills for this type of weapon.

hx1.name: Volt Ore
hx1.description: This marvel of nature has electrical properties. Use lightning weapons to deal damage to it.

hx2.name: Frost Ore
hx2.description: This marvel of nature has ice properties. Use frost weapons to deal damage to it.

hx3.name: Fire Ore
hx3.description: This marvel of nature has fire properties. Use flame weapons to deal damage to it.

FoldingJump.name: Spacerift
FoldingJump.description: A loophole that occurs when space is not completely stable, going through the spacerift will result in transmission to a distant place.

Guide_FollowNest.name: Sandy Rats Homecoming
Guide_FollowNest.description: The sand grass rats that love to get lost often put down special plants along the road to mark their way back home, yet they still somehow manage to lose their sense of direction. Bring them back to their nest to receive their gratitude.

Guide_GuessNest.name: Exchanging Sandy Nests
Guide_GuessNest.description: The mischievous sand grass rats keep swapping their nests. Find the special one among them to receive their recognition, as well as some reward.

Guide_EternalWatcher.name: Surveillance Guard
Guide_EternalWatcher.description: By interrupting the surveillance guard before it shuts down, its cores stored inside can be obtained.

Guide_worldCactus.name: Cactus Fruit
Guide_worldCactus.description: A very common plant in Vera, but what's strange is that it seems to contain a special fruit in its unopened cactus. Break the fruit to reap the core.

Guide_worldFluorescentMu.name: Cave Mushroom
Guide_worldFluorescentMu.description: A mushroom plant that can only be found in the caves of Vera, but it appears to have stopped growing... Find a special strange object nearby to make it grow again.

Guide_LaserJump.name: Laser Corridor
Guide_LaserJump.description: Avoiding infrared sensors is allegedly a mandatory part of Security Special Forces training. Let's see how many waves of them you can duck.

Guide_CarryBox.name: Box Haul
Guide_CarryBox.description: Score points by moving boxes to designated locations. It's a common part-time job in Mirroria. To certain people, the meager pay constitutes their entire income.

Guide_MoveShoot.name: Wings Tour
Guide_MoveShoot.description: The wings will give you a tour around Mirroria, shoot energy crystals with weapons on the wings along the way. Score reward points by hitting the crystals.

Guide_RollBall.name: Ball Toss
Guide_RollBall.description: Hoist the ball on the platform and toss it into the highlighted circle for points. Wonder how far it would go if there was no resistance...

Guide_MoveArchery.name: Elemental Magic Box
Guide_MoveArchery.description: Attack with elements corresponding to the color of magic boxes. Test your luck and reflexes, and see how many boxes you can blast today.

Guide_NoteACrash_VeraCity.name: Rhythm Score
Guide_NoteACrash_VeraCity.description: It's time to test your sense of rhythm. Strike the approaching notes to score points. It's a fad in Mirroria right now to lose yourself in the music and sweat.

Guide_Boss_hum_030.description: A peculiar creature in the shape of a moose that exhibits the features of both a Grayspace Entity and Vera local wildlife. It is artificially created by Mirroria based on Grayspace Entities.

Guide_Boss_hum_035.description: An Abyssant that resembles a whale. Due to the sheer destructive force of the Devourer, humans had to retreat into Mirroria and rely on its force field to thwart Grayspace Entity attacks.

Guide_Boss_hum_072.description: The Weaver is a recently logged Abyssant variant that is able to attack by controlling flying swords using telekinesis and is able to restrict enemy movements by manipulating space.

Guide_mon_hum_063.description: Saber-toothed wolves generally hunt and move as a pack in the Vera Desert. They are agile and often gang up on a single prey.

Guide_mon_hum_064.description: The shielded beast is a mild herbivore. It stores a lot of water inside its body. When attacked, it will chill the water into iceballs and counterattack by spewing them at the enemy.

Guide_mon_hum_065.description: The giant horn rhino is a mild herbivore. Its gigantic horns are its primary weapon of defense.

Guide_mon_hum_067.description: The gooseneck beast is a mild herbivore. It's able to emit a powerful sound wave to scare away enemies.

Guide_mon_hum_069.description: The horror beast is extremely territorial and would attack any target that intrudes upon its territory. It pounces on its victims and attacks with its claws.

Guide_mon_hum_069_G.description: The heavy hammer is a nickname for a horror beast possessed by a Grayspace Entity. It exhibits other methods of attacks when possessed.

Guide_mon_hum_070.description: The ripper is a powerful Grayspace Entity. It's stealthy and nimble, and its attacks are infused with lightning. It is a Grayspace Entity on the verge of evolving into an Abyssant.

Guide_mon_hum_071.description: Stalkers are powerful Grayspace Entities. They were also the first logged Grayspace Entity in Mirroria's database. A stalker can emit high voltage electricity from its body to attack its targets.

Guide_mon_hum_073.description: A cross-shaped Grayspace Entity that primarily attacks by emitting or summoning beams. It has a certain degree of charging capabilities, but is considered low-threat.

Guide_mon_hum_074.description: A Grayspace Entity that resembles an octopus that attacks by swinging or spinning its tentacles. It has a certain degree of teleportation capabilities.

Guide_mon_hum_077.description: An otter that inhabits the Vera Desert. They usually are found in groups in oasis or near water sources inside caves. They are easily alerted but generally do not initiate attacks.

Guide_mon_hum_083.description: A sentient cactus-shaped creature that usually disguises itself as a cactus. It waits until the target is within range before attacking.

Guide_mon_hum_084.description: A creature commonly found in the desert and oasis. They are territorial and aggressive. They primarily attack by shooting spider webs.

Guide_mon_hum_086.description: The original form of infernal steel lizards. They often burrow into the sand and wait until the target is within range before attacking.

Guide_mon_hum_087.description: A reptile of the desert that often burrows into the sand and wait until the target is within range before attacking. They primarily attack by spewing out hot magma.

Guide_mon_hum_094.description: A flamboyant desert hare that is quite feisty but less threatening. They primarily attack with their claws and by ramming their targets.

Guide_mon_hum_061_anyu.description:
The furioth is a common creature of the Twilight Zone, able to attack by spewing fireballs.
They can be driven away by the light from a charged <jinse>yellow</> crystal.
Furioths cannot truly die as they will revive after a time upon death.

Guide_mon_ele_004_anyu.description:
Blind parasites are terrifying enemies found within the Twilight Zone that attack from under the ground.
The blind parasites in the Twilight Zone cannot be driven away by Mi-a's yellow light.

Guide_mon_hum_060_anyu.description:
Blindeyes are special creatures found in the Twilight Zone. Long-term exposure to the crystal's effects has made them immune to any form of light.
The blindeyes in the Twilight Zone cannot be driven away by Mi-a's yellow light.

Guide_mon_hum_060_anyu_invisible.description:
The inviseye is an evolved variant of the blindeye. Long-term exposure to purple crystals has given it the ability to become invisible.
Inviseyes in the Twilight Zone cannot be attacked while they are invisible. Only the light from a charged <jinse>purple</> can make them vulnerable.

Guide_mon_hum_066.description: The star antelope is a gentle herbivore. It's light-footed and its gigantic horns that open up like a pair of wings are its most obvious feature. The horns also emit a soft glow in the dark like stars.

Guide_mon_hum_075.description: A spider-shaped basic Grayspace Entity that attacks with the floating blades at its sides.

Guide_mon_hum_076.description: A mantis-shaped basic Grayspace Entity that excels at traversing difficult terrains.

Guide_mon_hum_100.description: An elite Grayspace Entity. Its peculiar head and arm armor provide it with good defensive capabilities. Must be dealt with carefully when encountered.

Guide_mon_hum_101.description: An elite Grayspace Entity and an excellent hunter that doesn't let its prey escape easily. Must be dealt with carefully when encountered.

Guide_mon_hum_102.description: A Grayspace Entity with frenzied berserker attacks. Must be dealt with carefully when encountered.

Guide_mon_hum_103.description: A Grayspace Entity that exhibits a streamlined appearance. Must be dealt with carefully when encountered.

Guide_mon_hum_104.description: An elite Grayspace Entity that attacks with a staff. It may be seen rugged but not lacking in elegance and fierceness. Must be dealt with carefully when encountered.

Guide_mon_hum_105.description: A basic Grayspace Entity equipped with a sword and shield. Has both offensive and defensive capabilities.

Guide_mon_hum_106.description: An elite Grayspace Entity that attacks with a greatsword. Must be dealt with carefully when encountered.

Guide_boss_hum_036.description: An extremely dangerous creature that resembles a hippopotamus. Affected by the Confounding Abyss, a portion of its body is fused with some kind of crystal, resulting in its rock-like body.

Guide_boss_hum_038.description: An extremely dangerous Abyssant that resembles a wild beast. It shares many features with the G-Ripper, but the G-Ripper pales in comparison in terms of brute force.

Guide_boss_hum_042.description: An extremely dangerous humanoid Abyssant. Its gigantic fists can smash through anything. Its appearance shocked the entire world.

Guide_boss_hum_006_xmkk_world.description: A collection of corrupted plant-based aberration that uses plants to repulse enemies. It was once beautiful and pure, but its spite from beyond the grave drives it to bloom uncontrollably.

Guide_WhiteOre.name: White crystal
Guide_WhiteOre.description: These glittering and translucent crystals are abundant in the Twilight Zone. They can provide Mi-a with White Lighting Energy.

Guide_RedOre.name: Red crystal
Guide_RedOre.description: Rare crystals in the Twilight Zone. They can provide Mi-a with Red Lighting Energy and <jinse>enhance the Wanderer's attack abilities</>.

Guide_YellowOre.name: Yellow crystal
Guide_YellowOre.description: Rare crystals in the Twilight Zone. They can provide Mi-a with Yellow Lighting Energy and <jinse>dispel some enemies in the Twilight Zone</>.

Guide_GreenOre.name: Green crystal
Guide_GreenOre.description: The scarce crystals stored in the Twilight Zone can provide Mi-a with Green Lighting Energy and <jinse>continuously restore the Wanderer's HP</>. They can also be used to <jinse>charge Energy Supply Devices</> in the Twilight Zone.

Guide_PurpleOre.name: Purple crystal
Guide_PurpleOre.description: These glittering and translucent crystals are rare in the Twilight Zone. They can provide Mi-a with Purple Lighting Energy and <jinse>enhance the Wanderer's movement abilities</>. They can also be used to <jinse>reveal the enemies and objects from invisibility</>.

Guide_TreasureBox_Charged.name: Secret recharge box
Guide_TreasureBox_Charged.description: In the chaos of the Twilight Zone, there are many charging treasure boxes. Reveal and access the boxes with Mi-a's <jinse>Green Energy Lighting</>.

Guide_TreasureBox_Camouflage.name: Disguised secret box
Guide_TreasureBox_Camouflage.description: In the chaos of the Twilight Zone, there are many disguised treasure boxes. Reveal and access the boxes with Mi-a's <jinse>Purple Energy Lighting</>.

Guide_TreasureBox_Invisible.name: Invisible secret box
Guide_TreasureBox_Invisible.description: In the chaos of the Twilight Zone, there are many invisible treasure boxes. Reveal and access the boxes with Mi-a's <jinse>Purple Energy Lighting</>.

Guide_TreasureBox_Monster.name: Secured secret box
Guide_TreasureBox_Monster.description: In the chaos of the Twilight Zone, there are many threat treasure boxes. The boxes will automatically open <jinse>when all the nearby enemies have been dispelled beyond the threat range</>.

Guide_TreasureBox_Common.name: Large secret box
Guide_TreasureBox_Common.description: In the chaos of the Twilight Zone, there are many giant treasure boxes. Access the boxes <jinse>when all the nearby Energy Supply Devices have been charged</>.

Guide_TreasureBox_Boss.name: Guarded secret box
Guide_TreasureBox_Boss.description: In the chaos of the Twilight Zone, there are many guarded treasure boxes that are protected by elite enemies nearby. <jinse>Defeat the enemies</> to open the boxes.

Guide_ChargedDevice_TreasureBox.name: Power supply
Guide_ChargedDevice_TreasureBox.description: Located near all kinds of treasure boxes, Mi-a can charge it with <jinse>Green Energy Lighting</>.

Guide_ChargedDevice_TreasureBox_Camoufla.name: Fake power supply
Guide_ChargedDevice_TreasureBox_Camoufla.description: Located near all kinds of treasure boxes, Mi-a can reveal it with <jinse>Purple Energy Lighting</> and then charge it.

Guide_ChargedDevice_TreasureBox_Invisibl.name: Invisible power supply
Guide_ChargedDevice_TreasureBox_Invisibl.description: Located near all kinds of treasure boxes, Mi-a can reveal it from invisibility with <jinse>Purple Energy Lighting</> and then charge it.

Guide_ChargedDevice_TreasureBox_Monster.name: Emergency power supply
Guide_ChargedDevice_TreasureBox_Monster.description: Located near all kinds of treasure boxes, the charging effect of the device has been interfered with by enemy units within the threat range. Mi-a will need to <jinse>dispel the enemies nearby with Yellow Energy Lighting</> before charging it.

Guide_PrimaryEnergy_Box.name: Crystal jar
Guide_PrimaryEnergy_Box.description: Aged crystal jars that store the rich supplies once mined by the developers of the Twilight Zone.

Guide_PrimaryEnergy_Camouflage.name: Fake jar
Guide_PrimaryEnergy_Camouflage.description: Disguised crystal storage tank. Mi-a can reveal it with <jinse>Purple Energy Lighting</> and then open it.

Guide_PrimaryEnergy_Invisible.name: Invisible jar
Guide_PrimaryEnergy_Invisible.description: Invisible crystal storage tank, Mi-a can reveal it from invisibility with <jinse>Purple Energy Lighting</> and then open it

Guide_DarkAreaFog.name: Dark matter cluster
Guide_DarkAreaFog.description: The collection of unknown matter in the Twilight Zone, known as the "Dark Matter Cluster," will <jinse>cause continuous damage</> if someone touches it.

Guide_WorldHauntedEnergy.name: Energy Body Recovery
Guide_WorldHauntedEnergy.description: A strange energy body collection device. Once activated, unstable energy bodies will scatter. Collide with and retrieve the energy bodies within its duration to obtain a reward generated by the device.

Guide_WorldCombatEngine.name: Combat Simulation Device
Guide_WorldCombatEngine.description: A special information collection device. Once activated, it attracts creatures while recording combat data and environmental data. Defeat all creatures and complete the collection during its active duration to obtain a reward.

Guide_TimeLimitedPlatform.name: Hidden Path
Guide_TimeLimitedPlatform.description: Strike the device to activate the hidden path and collect its rewards before it's hidden again. Strike the device while the path is revealed to reset its timer.

Guide_CorrosiveOre.name: Marzoid Ore Gathering
Guide_CorrosiveOre.description: Activate a <jinse>power supply</> to crack open a Marzoid Ore's carapace, then use a weapon with the corresponding element to strike its internal structure and obtain rewards.
